name: v4.9.4
body:
## Commits
- 5f49e30: add release version (gtebrean)
- 52a9c2f: Merge branch 'master' into release/4.9.4 (gtebrean)
- 7e18756: set release version to 4.9.4 (gtebrean)
- 14483a9: release 4.9.4 trigger flow again (gtebrean)

## What's Changed
* Fix private transaction manager by @antonydenyer in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1748
* Fix NPE in try-catch by @matthew-cameron1 in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1745
* Bump versions by @gtebrean in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1750

## New Contributors
* @matthew-cameron1 made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1745

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/web3j/web3j/compare/v4.9.3...v4.9.4

name: v4.9.3
body:
## What's Changed
* Privacy public key length constraint removed by @freemanzMrojo in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1715
* Add QBFT API methods providing access to the QBFT consensus engine by @mkrielza in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1729
* Fix Android compatibility for API < 26 by @RobertoArtiles in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1717
* Fix polling processors to attempts work as expected by @rymuff in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1716
* Support EmptyTransactionReceipt in Contract by @rymuff in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1714
* update jackson vesion by @gtebrean in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1735
* Fix abi parsing to be supported by openApi by @gtebrean in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1740
* bump versions by @gtebrean in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1743

## New Contributors
* @freemanzMrojo made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1715
* @mkrielza made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1729
* @RobertoArtiles made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1717
* @rymuff made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1716

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/web3j/web3j/compare/v4.9.2...v4.9.3

name: v4.9.2
body:
## Commits
- 61d1c6f: Bumped Version to 4.9.2 (AlexandrouR)

## What's Changed
* add BigInteger gets to baseFeePerGas, maxPriorityFeePerGas and maxFee… by @yasseralaa in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1477
* Generate functions to get the ABI encoding of function selector and parameters by @drinkcoffee in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1537
* Minor version updates by @AlexandrouR in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1546
* Fix ClassCastException when using native types (default) and arrays. by @alexdupre in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1494
* Fixes external struct codegen by @SweeXordious in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1570
* updates besu version to avoid log4shell vulnerability. by @SweeXordious in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1572
* fix full debug trace info serialization by @mfornos in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1550
* Implement epi1014 create2 by @ZhiyuCircle in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1540
* Fix wrapper generator to create Struct java native constructor  by @andrii-kl in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1597
* Feature/364 integretion with hsm by @andrii-kl in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1602
* 366 add chainid field, fix chainid calculation by @andrii-kl in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1608
* Upgrade java websocket dependencies to 1.5.2 (fix CVE-2020-11050) by @maximegris in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1601
* Add missing third party dependency to list by @intertin in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1599
* Corrected link and added description where missing by @soumyajitsamanta in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1596
* Fix/1564 change exception message fix eip 2544 by @andrii-kl in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1612
* add test for PR 1537 by @AlexandrouR in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1614
* JSON-RPC error details by @dparmar in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1532
* 368 upgrade jnr unixsocket to 0.38.17 (fix CVE-2020-15250) (#1616) by @andrii-kl in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1618
* Update snapshot version to 4.9.0 by @AlexandrouR in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1619
* DO NOT MERGE add trace call many by @frankisawesome in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1626
* Spotless by @AlexandrouR in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1630
* Update Contributions guide by @AlexandrouR in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1632
* FIX-1318 | update solidity java wrapper event parameters by @gtebrean in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1637
* FIX-1475 | add encodePacked by @gtebrean in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1628
* fixes #Fix-1503 by @gtebrean in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1642
* Fix 1468 by @gtebrean in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1654
* updates vulnerable jackson version by @SweeXordious in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1655
* FIX-1240 - Race condition in java.util.ServiceLoader by @gtebrean in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1648
* README cosmetics by @SweeXordious in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1663
* Add support for new EIP-1559 RPC methods. by @alexdupre in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1651
* Fix reconnect on refused connection by @zilm13 in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1645
* Add support for EIP-1559 smart contract transactions. by @alexdupre in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1638
* bump snapshot version by @gtebrean in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1671
* Fix EIP712 encodeType with Array by @OptimisticQuan in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1683
* Downgrade log level from error to warn by @ZhiyuCircle in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1674
* Fix recId calculation by @mbaxter in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1587
* Add validation for recovery id parameter by @andrii-kl in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1692
* Fix ABI JSON parser/definition. by @alexdupre in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1647
* Fix retrieval of revert reason by using the same weiAmount in the call. by @alexdupre in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1656
* Don't allow leading zeroes for quantities by @Xilis in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1679
* Feature/1603 ens offchain integration by @andrii-kl in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1617
* Make functions parsing the event logs explicitly static. by @alexdupre in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1650
* Fix array types in solidity struct constructor by @vchernetskyi993 in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1673

## New Contributors
* @drinkcoffee made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1537
* @mfornos made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1550
* @ZhiyuCircle made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1540
* @andrii-kl made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1597
* @maximegris made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1601
* @intertin made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1599
* @soumyajitsamanta made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1596
* @dparmar made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1532
* @frankisawesome made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1626
* @gtebrean made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1637
* @zilm13 made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1645
* @OptimisticQuan made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1683
* @mbaxter made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1587
* @Xilis made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1679
* @vchernetskyi993 made their first contribution in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/1673

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/web3j/web3j/compare/v4.8.8...v4.9.2

name: Dynamic Gas Support (v3.4.0)
body:
The 3.4 release of web3j provides some awesome new functionality.

# Dynamic gas price providers

Although web3j does provide the ability to modify the gas price and limit on transactions, it was performed in a relatively inflexible manner, where a setter was used to modify it on smart contracts. web3j now supports a [ContractGasProvider](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/blob/master/core/src/main/java/org/web3j/tx/gas/ContractGasProvider.java) interface which can be used for specifying gas price and limits dynamically on a per contract call basis.

For more information refer to the [docs](file:///Users/Conor/code/java/web3j-docs/smart_contracts.html#dynamic-gas-price-and-limit)

Thanks to @yuriymyronovych for this great [enhancement](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/398).

# Multi-dimensional arrays

It's now possible to work with multi-dimensional arrays in the [smart contract wrappers](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/404).

Thanks to @fergarrui for this great update.

# Other enhancements

There's been a significant number of community contributions these are all listed below, which is a great testament to the ever growing web3j community!

Special thanks to @fcorneli, @mushketyk and @iongchun for all of their input here.

- Projects: ethereum-tool and ethereum-resource-adapter [#517](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/517)

There are some great new features in this milestone release.

This release provides a number of minor bug fixes, including:

1. Enhanced error message in Abi Types (#325) - thank you @eepstein
1. Error processing SafeVarArgs on Android (#281), thank you @joanesespanol

name: v3.2.0
body:
This release provides a workaround for the connection timeout issues being experienced by users connecting to the Ethereum node when using filters (which are the enablers for the Observables API). Details of the fix are available in https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/280, and the following issues, are useful for background https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/144, https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/279, https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/197.

It also provides ERC20 interfaces, which are a building block for the following [issue ](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/213) which hopefully will be implemented in the near future. This is detailed in PR https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/239. Thanks to @eepstein for his contributions so far.

name: ENS and Truffle (v3.1.0)
body:
## ENS support

web3j now supports [Ethereum Name Service (ENS)](https://ens.domains/) lookups for contract and wallet addresses.

This means that anywhere you previously had to use a contract or wallet address, you can now use an ENS domain name instead.

I.e. For your smart contracts you can use:

```java
YourSmartContract contract = YourSmartContract.load(
        "0x<address>|<ensName>", 
        web3j, credentials, GAS_PRICE, GAS_LIMIT);
```

It also is supported in web3j’s command line tools:

```bash
$ web3j wallet send <walletfile> 0x<address>|<ensName>
```

## Truffle support

The Truffle Framework is a very popular choice for both JavaScript and Solidity developers alike. Truffle provides a [contract schema](https://github.com/trufflesuite/truffle-contract-schema) in JSON to represent contracts deployed to the various Ethereum networks.

web3j can now work with Truffle JSON files for generating smart contract wrappers. This means that if you currently or have used Truffle for your smart contract development, you can generate smart contract wrappers in Java from them. 

The advantage of this approach is that your smart contracts will know where they’ve been deployed previously.

```java
YourSmartContract contract = YourSmartContract.load(
        YourSmartContract.getDeployedAddress(<network id>), 
        web3j, credentials, GAS_PRICE, GAS_LIMIT);
```

Where the network id is as per [EIP 155](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-155.md#list-of-chain-ids).

To generate the wrapper files, there is a new truffle argument to the web3j command line tool:

```bash
$ web3j truffle generate [--javaTypes|--solidityTypes] /path/to/<truffle-smart-contract-output>.json -o /path/to/src/main/java -p com.your.organisation.name
```

@eepstein  deserves the credit for this change, as he had the idea and implemented it.


## Other items

- Increment id field on requests (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/232) by @IgorPerikov 
- Fixed compiler warnings (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/224) by @joanesespanol 
- Event objects containing String and array members are now represented using byte[] values
- Module dependencies on Bintray not being pulled down (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/219)

name: El Devcon 3 especial (v3.0.1)
body:
Following months of development, just in time for Devcon 3 the web3j 3.0 milestone release has dropped. This release provides numerous enhancements aimed at making it even easier to work with Ethereum and smart contracts in JVM languages.

**Modular**

web3j is now a modular project. For each web3j release, a number of artifacts are published:

* utils - Minimal set of utility classes
* rlp - Recursive Length Prefix (RLP) encoders
* abi - Application Binary Interface (ABI) encoders
* core - Much like the previous web3j core artifact without the code generators
* crypto - Ethereum crypto libraries
* geth - Geth specific JSON-RPC module
* parity - Parity specific JSON-RPC module
* tuples - Simple tuples library
* codegen - code generators
* infura - Infura specific HTTP header support

The motivation here is to give developers (especially Android) more choice on which parts of the library they wish to use. My hope is also that this will encourage standardisation and reuse throughout the Ethereum ecosystem for those developers building on the JVM, so that these libraries are not being reimplemented time and time again in different projects.

For almost all use cases, if you were using web3j core previously you shouldn't have any problems dropping in the 3.0 core. Behind the scenes, there's been some refactoring, but much of the same functionality is there. You will need to regenerate your smart contract wrappers to use this release.


**Native Java types in smart contract wrappers**

web3j's smart contract wrappers now use native Java types by default. This means that the following Java to Solidity type conversions take place behind the scenes for you:

boolean -> bool
BigInteger -> uint/int
byte[] -> bytes
String -> string and address types
List<> -> dynamic/static array

This significantly reduces the amount of code you write, but still offers the same protection with native Solidity types in Java behind the scenes.


**Updated API for remote calls**

web3j previously provided async methods on its smart contract wrappers that returned a future. A new RemoteCall type is now returned, which makes it easy to choose if you want to make a remote call to an Ethereum client synchronously, asynchronously (via a CompletableFuture in Java, or Future in Android), or an Observable.

As mentioned previoysly, this does mean that you'll need to regenerate your smart contract wrappers to use web3j 3.0, but the upside is that you have a much cleaner API, and can take advantage of the numerous smart contract wrapper enhancements that came with the 3.0 release. 


**Migration to OkHttp**

web3j now uses the excellent [OkHttp](https://github.com/square/okhttp) library for all HTTP communication.


**Parity and Geth JSON-RPC support**

All of the Geth and Parity specific personal module calls are now available in web3j. Additionally web3j also supports the Parity trace module.

Thanks to @iikirilov for submitting this change.


**Tuples for multiple return values in smart contracts**

web3j now provides a simple Tuple type which is used by its smart contract wrappers that return multiple values. Previously this was done with lists which required casting to the correct type if there were different types returned by the method.


**Transaction receipt processors**

web3j provides an abstraction layer for working with Ethereum transactions whereby when you submit a transaction to the network, it continually polls your Ethereum node for a transaction receipt passing this back to the caller once one is available, indicating the transaction has been mined and placed into a block on the network.

With the 3.0 release you are able to modify how web3j polls for transactions. The default behaviour still remains the same. However, should you want to have lots of transactions in flight, web3j provides a queue that can be used to poll for those transactions, reducing the number of threads being created by the library.

You can read more [here](https://docs.web3j.io/smart_contracts.html#transaction-receipt-processors).


**Transaction signing via third parties**

The transaction signing logic has been refactored allowing the signing of transactions via third parties (previously it had to be performed in web3j). This means that if you want to call out to an HSM or wallet from web3j you can.

Thanks to @eztierney for submitting this change.


**Documentation updates**

All web3j documentation has been updated to reflect the changes to the library. If you find a broken link, or any discrepancies, please raise an issue, or better yet create a PR :) with details of what's wrong. I want to keep the standard of documentation for the library high (having invested heavily in it), so any feedback is gratefully received.


**Other changes**

* Removed Scrypt dependency (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/165) by @dmitrychaban 
* Support for providing custom headers in the HttpService (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/200) by @mawenpeng
* Potential SecureRandom vulnerability on Android (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/146) highlighted @ligi 
* Better static arrays support (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/183) by @jaycarey 
* Restrict historical filters to LogFilter (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/154) by @the-wastl 
* Increment id field on requests (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/210) by @IgorPerikov 
* Allow range observables to emit one value (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/184) by @iikirilov 
* Removing the duplicated calls for installing and uninstalling the filter (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/212) by @mochalovv
* Smart contract wrappers only require the specification of the Ether parameter if the associated methods contain the payable modifier (previously a zero value had to be provided regardless) 
* Chain Id's have been brought in line with the [EIP-155 specification](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-155.md)
* Transaction utility methods have been added for generating transaction hashes

Please accept my apologies if I've missed your contribution of the list - pull requests and issues are one of the main mechanisms to get feedback from users on the library, so I appreciate people taking the time to submit them.

name: El Devcon 3 especial (v3.0.0-android)
body: See [v3.0.0](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/releases/tag/v3.0.0) for release notes.

name: v2.3.1
body:
This release fixes *NullPointerException* after *transactionObservable().subscribe* 
 (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/152).

name: v2.3.0
body:
This release contains a number of fixes and enhancements to web3j.

Enhancements:

* Support event filters from block 0/earliest enhancement (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/100)
* Optionally provide raw JSON-RPC response in Response objects (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/111)
* Support payable functions in wrapper generator (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/138)
* Network IDs for Rinkeby and Kovan (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/116)

Bug fixes:

* Leading Zeros of Function Code Removed in Transaction (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/104)
* When toAddress is 0x00211e7e624178e5bc57f9d1e6115ad65f3e76b8, raw transaction broadcast fails (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/112)
* RLP Problem with small lists (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/124)
* geth response "input string too short for address" when call sendTransaction (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/127)
* JsonMappingException fix when compiling a solidity contract with eth_compileSolidity (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/128)
* Dirty read in "FastRawTransactionManager", variable should be defined volatile (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/128)

name: v2.2.2
body: Minor release to address handling of empty (0x) responses from ethCall (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/98).

name: v2.2.1
body: Minor update that fixes an issue with the isValid() call on contract wrappers which were returning false for bytecode that contained multiple embedded contracts.

name: v2.2.0 A historical perspective
body:
### Observable API enhcements

This release provides a number of enhancements to web3j's Observable API. You can now request historical ranges of blocks from the blockchain on demand.

To replay a range of blocks from the blockchain:

```java
Subscription subscription = web3j.replayBlocksObservable(
        <startBlockNumber>, <endBlockNumber>, <fullTxObjects>)
        .subscribe(block -> {
                 ...
});
```

To replay the individual transactions contained within a range of blocks:

```java
Subscription subscription = web3j.replayTransactionsObservable(
        <startBlockNumber>, <endBlockNumber>)
        .subscribe(tx -> {
                 ...
});
```

You can also get web3j to replay all blocks up to the most current, and provide notification
(via the submitted Observable) once you've caught up:

```java
Subscription subscription = web3j.catchUpToLatestBlockObservable(
        <startBlockNumber>, <fullTxObjects>, <onCompleteObservable>)
        .subscribe(block -> {
                 ...
});
```

Or, if you'd rather replay all blocks to the most current, then be notified of new subsequent
blocks being created:

```java
Subscription subscription = web3j.catchUpToLatestAndSubscribeToNewBlocksObservable(
        <startBlockNumber>, <fullTxObjects>)
        .subscribe(block -> {
                 ...
});
```

I was able to replay the entire Ropsten blockchain ex. transactions (941667 blocks) in 7m22s. All transactions from Ropsten could be replayed in 41m16s on a 2013 Macbook Pro. Just make sure you use [IPC](https://github.com/web3j/web3j#ipc) to connect to your Ethereum node.

Smart contract wrapper event Observables also now provide startBlock and endBlockParameters, so you can specify the range with which you want the log or event filters to cover.

For further information refer to the [filters documentation](https://docs.web3j.io/filters.html).


### Smart contract verification

Smart contract wrappers now include an [isValid()](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/blob/master/src/main/java/org/web3j/tx/Contract.java#L108) method to verify that the deployed bytecode at the smart contract's address matches that of the smart contract wrapper.


### Long parameter values added to Solidity integer types

All of the Uint and Int Solidity types now support construction with long values, instead of only BigIntegers as was previously the case. DefaultBlockParameterNumber's also now accept long values.


### Async changes

Behind the scenes in the smart contract wrappers, web3j now performs synchronous requests with Ethereum clients. This is to reduce the overhead that CompletableFutures were placing on the JVM thread pool. Completable futures are now only used in the client API for smart contract wrappers.

### Other issues/pull requests

- msg.sender not set properly in contract function call (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/89)
- Expose SolidityFunctionWrapperGenerator Method for other libaries (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/86)
- Add initial value documentation (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/73)
- Fix problems around size validation of large uint values (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/71)
- Calls on contract hang after event subscription (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/69)
- Sign.signedMessageToKey() can't be called because the Sign.SignatureData class is not public. (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/64)
- Java smart contract wrappers does not support ABI with type of "address[] storage" (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/63)
- Nonce calculated without counting pendig tx (https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/54)

name: Faster contract deployment (v2.1.0-android)
body: See [v2.1.0](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/releases/tag/v2.1.0) for release notes.

name: Faster contract deployment (v2.1.0)
body:
**Configurable polling intervals on contract deployment** 

The main purpose of this release is to enable users to configure the polling frequency on new smart contract deployments. Previously this was not possible, which meant that [web3j-quorum](https://github.com/web3j/quorum) users had to wait 15 seconds before their contracts could be deployed.


**TransactionReceipts on contract deployment**

It is now possible to obtain the TransactionReceipt associated with a contract deployment via *\<contract\>.getTransactionReceipt()*. This is only set when you call a *\<contract\>.deploy(...)* method, it will not be present on \*<contract\>.load(...)* methods, as no transaction takes place behind the scenes.

**TransactionManager from addresses**

TransactionManagers now contain a *getFromAddress()* method to provide the sender address associated with the TransactionManager. Thanks to [androlo](https://github.com/androlo) for the [suggestion](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/61).

name: v2.0.2
body: This release addresses https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/59 Contract deployments failing with ClientTransactionManager.

name: v2.0.1
body:
This is a minor release addressing https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/58 where the generated code for event functions wrappers was always using a lowercase function name.

This release only affects the smart contract wrapper generator, so will only require an upgrade to the web3j command line tools for most users.

name: Transaction managers and event wrappers (v2.0.0-android)
body: See [v2.0.0](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/releases/tag/v2.0.0) for release notes.

name: Transaction managers and event wrappers (v2.0.0)
body:
This milestone release incorporates a number of key features:

### Transaction managers

Transaction managers allow you to choose how you transact with Ethereum clients via web3j's [smart contract wrappers](https://web3j.github.io/web3j/smart_contracts.html#transaction-managers). For instance, you can now choose if you wish to have web3j sign your transactions, or the Ethereum client that you submit the transaction to the network via. You can also specify the chain id as per [EIP-155](http://docs.web3j.io/smart_contracts.html#specifying-the-chain-id-on-transactions-eip-155) to prevent replay of transactions.

This also simplifies working with other Ethereum platforms such [Quorum](https://github.com/jpmorganchase/quorum) via [web3j-quorum](https://github.com/web3j/quorum), which works natively with web3j 2.0+ generated smart contract wrappers, with full transaction privacy support.

A [fast transaction manager](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/blob/master/src/main/java/org/web3j/tx/FastRawTransactionManager.java) has also been created to facilitate sending multiple raw transactions per block.

Thanks to [ferOnti](https://github.com/ferOnti) for all of his input on working with higher throughput transactions.

### Reactive,  typed events

Events in generated smart contracts wrappers are now fully typed. E.g. in the ERC20 smart contract wrappers, you have the following event definition:

```
event Transfer(address indexed _from, address indexed _to, uint256 _value);
```

You now have the following event object type in the corresponding smart contract wrapper Java code:

``` java
public static class TransferEventResponse {
        public Address _from;

        public Address _to;

        public Uint256 _value;
    }
```

You can then get details of those events via the transaction receipt:

``` java
public List<TransferEventResponse> getTransferEvents(TransactionReceipt transactionReceipt)
```

Or get an Observable that creates a filter providing events as they happen on the blockchain:

``` java
public Observable<TransferEventResponse> transferEventObservable()
```

See [HumanStandardToken](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/blob/master/src/integration-test/java/org/web3j/generated/HumanStandardToken.java) for further details.

Thanks to [@tramonex-nate](https://github.com/tramonex-nate) for this great enhancement.

### Default values

Default values are now available on all Solidity types. E.g. if you wish to provide an empty value to a smart contract wrapper, use <_Type_>.DEFAULT. 

Thanks to [@thedoctor](https://github.com/thedoctor) who provided this change.

### Versioning

web3j jars now contain details of the build version. You can query this from your code via the [Version](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/blob/master/src/main/java/org/web3j/utils/Version.java) class.

The version is now provided with the web3j command line tools, which incidentally are now available on [Homebrew](https://github.com/web3j/homebrew-web3j).

```
$ brew tap web3j/web3j
$ brew install web3j
$ web3j version

              _      _____ _     _        
             | |    |____ (_)   (_)       
__      _____| |__      / /_     _   ___  
\ \ /\ / / _ \ '_ \     \ \ |   | | / _ \ 
 \ V  V /  __/ |_) |.___/ / | _ | || (_) |
  \_/\_/ \___|_.__/ \____/| |(_)|_| \___/ 
                         _/ |             
                        |__/              

Version: 2.0.0
Build timestamp: 2017-02-10 06:45:22.537 UTC
```

### Light wallet generation

For working with resource constrained devices such as smartphones, web3j now provides two types of wallet file generation, full and light. Previously only the full generation was available. Running a simple benchmark locally, full wallet files can be generated in ~700 msecs, versus ~50 msecs for light.

See the [WalletUtils](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/blob/master/src/main/java/org/web3j/crypto/WalletUtils.java) class for more information.

### Breaking changes

The Contract class has been migrated to the [tx](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/tree/master/src/main/java/org/web3j/tx) package along with the TransactionManager components.
Block and Transaction responses from Ethereum clients are no longer contained within an optional. This is to reduce the number of _Optional.get()_ calls that were required when working with the Future and Observable APIs.

### Bug fixes
- https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/43 RLP zero prefixed string
- https://github.com/web3j/web3j/pull/46 Replace Java internal API and make file seprator OS-specific
- https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/53 Compiling contract inside Java code

name: v1.1.2 The IPC Release
body:
Provides IpcService for connecting to Ethereum clients over IPC for *nix based OS's.

Contains a number of bug fixes & pull requests submitted by the community.

**Update** web3j command line tools are now available via Homebrew of OS X users:

```
brew tap web3j/web3j
brew install web3j
```

name: v1.1.1
body:
This release contains a fix for the following issue:
- [Public functions does not have a correct function name](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/34)

Additionally web3j-tests.jar artifacts are now being published to Maven/JFrog.

name: web3j goes reactive (v1.1.0-android)
body: See [v1.1.0](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/releases/tag/v1.1.0) for release notes.

name: web3j goes reactive (v1.1.0)
body:
This milestone release provides a couple of significant new features to web3j.

Firstly the JSON-RPC client API has been enhanced to integrate with RxJava's Observables. In addition to _web3j.< methodName >.[ send() | sendAsync ]_, you also have _observable()_ which will wrap the request in an observable, allowing straight forwards composition of JSON-RPC calls.

Secondly is the addition of web3j's filter API. web3j provides a fully asynchronous API for working with Ethereum client filters, so you no longer need to poll the client for filter updates. For instance, receiving a callback with all new blocks or transactions being created in Ethereum is very trivial. For more details refer to the new [Filters and Events](https://web3j.github.io/web3j/filters.html) section in the documentation.

name: v1.0.9-android
body:
This release addresses issues with the Apache HttpClient on Android.
See [here](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/releases/tag/v1.0.9) for details of core web3j changes.

name: v1.0.9
body: Workaround for differences in the Transaction objects returned by Geth and Parity. See this [issue](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/3339) for details.

name: v1.0.8-android
body: See [v1.0.8](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/releases/tag/v1.0.8) for release notes.

name: v1.0.8
body:
1. Fixed #21 where multiple String values being returned by functions were not being decoded correctly.
2. Added Infura support to command line tools wallet.
3. Fixed async issue where RuntimeExceptions were not being captured on certain calls.

name: v1.0.7-android
body: See [v1.0.7](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/releases/tag/v1.0.7) for release notes.

name: v1.0.7
body:
1. Updates to support new Geth Transaction Receipt fields added in 1.5 release.
2. Creation of a dedicated Infura client that manages Infura TLS certificates for you. So no more certificate imports!
3. Enhanced smart contract wrapper API to support multiple return values, such as those from a Solidity struct. See #18.

name: v1.0.6-android
body: See [v1.0.6](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/releases/tag/v1.0.6) for release notes.

name: v1.0.6
body:
A couple of updates:
- Update to smart contract wrapper API - gas price & limit are now required upon contract object instantiation.
- Fixed potential issue for working with zero prefixed Ethereum addresses & public keys.

name: v1.0.5-android
body:
web3j's first Android release!

_Note_:
- The binary was built using jdk1.7.0_40 with target and source compatibility set to version 1.6
- The code generator uses [JavaPoet](https://github.com/square/javapoet) which requires JDK 7+. Therefore for generating smart contract wrappers please use the command line tools that come as part of the  [1.0.5](https://github.com/web3j/web3j/releases/tag/v1.0.5) web3j distribution. All code generated is JDK 6+ compatible.

name: v1.0.5
body: Updated code generator to generate Android/Java 1.6 compatible smart contract wrappers.

name: v1.0.4
body:
1. Solidity generator: fixed issue where no-arg constructor functions were not being generated correctly - see #11 
2. Added logic to test for file existence with wallet tools before asking for password. 
3. Fixed bug in wallet file generator where 12 hour clocks we being used in filename.

name: v1.0.3
body:
Added web3j command line tools.

See http://docs.web3j.io/command_line.html for further information.

name: v1.0.2
body:
1. Added Transfer class for simplifying Ether transactions in line with existing Contract class for working with smart contracts.
2. Created command line tools for managing wallets.

name: v1.0.1
body: Addresses issue with unlocking accounts with Parity when no duration parameter is specified, see https://github.com/web3j/web3j/issues/8

name: v1.0.0
body:
1. Ethereum Wallet support
2. Refinements to smart contract wrapper generator
3. Core documentation written

name: v0.7.0
body:
The revised smart contract wrappers are now live! These wrappers support all common operations for working with smart contracts:
- Construction and deployment
- Invoking transactions and events
- Calling constant methods

name: v0.6.0
body:
1. Incorporated nonce into transactions being signed via Geth/Parity nodes 
2. Created EIP-20 standard token integration test 
3. Created Greeter integration test 
4. Addressed bug where function encoder wouldn't process "0x" properly if return arguments were expected 
5. Created Credentials container for account credentials 
6. Added additional smart contract source code 
7. Created Smart Contract documentation section 
8. Created troubleshooting documentation section 
9. Updates to transaction documentation 
10. Cleaned up layout of source files for other documentation files. 
11. Bumped version.

name: v0.5.5
body:
# Release notes
- Support for handling empty strings returned from smart contracts.
